p: Previous studies of N proteins of Hantaviruses revealed that strong B-cells epitopes are located near the amino-terminus [ 33, 34]. However, this does not seem to be the case for RVFV N. Genetic immunisations are in general believed to mimic the natural presentation of antigens [ 37], but interestingly, while the sera of immunised mice recognized the amino-terminal part (aa 1â€“100) of the N-protein, sera of the infected animals did not. The lack of reactivity towards the central (N2) and the C-terminal (N3) parts could either be explained by a distorted conformation of the encoded antigens or disruption of epitope-regions within the N protein.
